page.title: 02HEDNESFORD PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: In 1086 Hednesford was part of the royal hunting ground, Cannock Chase. Later, racehorses were trained on the Hills, but the emphasis upon leisure disappeared when the coal industry was established in the area at the end of the nineteenth century. Four collieries: the Â£Valley', Â£Fives', Cannock and Rugeley, and Wimblebury, were working up to the 1950s. With these mines came a main line railway, housing and employment. Today, only derelict workings lie as testimony to this recent industrial past, while numerous leisure facilities, including Wandon Caravan Park, Beaudesert Golf Club, Hednesford Raceway and the Chase itself, reveal that Hednesford has returned to its former role. With no industrial base, it provides recreation for its largely commuting population and visitors.
